data.prayer: Father, you desire to blot out the sins of the people of Babil, Iraq. You said, if they turn to you, you will dissolve their sins like mist.
data.verse: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, your transgressions, and, as a cloud, your sins. Return to me, for I have redeemed you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Babil, Iraq

data.prayer: Spirit, help the church in the state of Babil to exponentially multiply disciples.
Spirit, awaken a burning desire for your presence and intimacy among the 1,950,000 people living in the state of Babil.
Father, put the people who are lonely into families in the state of Babil.
data.verse: God sets the lonely in families. He brings out the prisoners with singing, but the rebellious dwell in a sun-scorched land.

data.prayer: Lord, please remember the Mahra people. you said you wanted worshippers of every tongue and tribe and nation, yet we know of no worshippers among them.
Pour your Spirit out on the 1,950,000 citizens of Babil, Iraq, so that they might know your name and the name of your Son.
data.verse: And afterward, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. your sons and daughters will prophesy, your old men will dream dreams, your young men will see visions.

data.prayer: Jesus, defend your people in the state of Babil against the difficulty of these last days.
data.verse: But mark this: There will be terrible times in the last days. 2 People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy, 3 without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good, 4 treacherous, rash, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God— 5 having a form of godliness but denying its power.

data.prayer: Father, for those in trouble in the state of Babil prompt them to call on you for rescue today.
data.verse: He will call on me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him.
